titleStmt.title: Astrological observations and predictions for the year of our Lord 1682. Wherein are briefly shewn, the significations of the late comet, (which appeared most manifestly to us in December 1680.) And of the two great eclipses of the moon ... : also monthly observations for every month this present year. Briefly containing the most remarkable events that are likely to happen in some nations, kingdoms, and cities / by John Silvester.
titleStmt.author: Silvester, John, 17th cent.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Christ Church (University of Oxford). Library.
